title: Tearaway explorer Stavely Minerals raises equity
text:
ASX-listed minerals explorer Stavely Minerals is seeking to capitalise on investor interest in the stock, which has seen its share price quadruple in the past three weeks.

Stavely was in front of investors with a $19 million equity raising at $1 a share on Thursday morning.

Stavely Minerals shares are in a trading halt. Peter Braig

The deal was launched by stockbroker Morgans and structured as an institutional placement.

It was priced at a 7.4 per cent discount to the last close and a 14.5 per cent discount to the five day VWAP, according to terms sent to potential investors.

Funds raised were for gold and copper-gold exploration, the term sheet said.

Morgans was calling for bids by 5pm on Thursday.

Stavely is a minerals explorer with projects in Victoria, Queensland and Tasmania. Recent investor interest was sparked by drilling results at its Thursday Gossan deposit.
description: ASX-listed minerals explorer Stavely Minerals is seeking to capitalise on recent investor interest in the stock
